items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message:
The Yeo and Parrett rivers levels remain high with further rain forecast on Wednesday and Thursday. 
Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if the drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. Property flooding is possible above 8.35m. For the latest river and drain levels refer to https://check-for-flooding.service.gov.uk/river-and-sea-levels.
We are continuing to monitor rainfall and river levels. River Parrett levels are being managed using the Parrett relief channel. We are operating our pumping stations when river levels allow. 
Avoid driving, cycling or walking through flood water. Refer to Somerset Council’s website for any local road closures. 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 18 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for: Lower Rivers Tone and Parrett including West Moor, Hay Moor, Curry Moor, Stan Moor, Salt Moor and North Moor. 
Due to the heavy rain, the River Tone level at Currymoor pumping station is high. Water is entering Currymoor reservoir via Hookbridge spillway as this level currently exceeds 7.45m.
Cutts Road floods when the drain level at Currymoor pumping station this level is above 5.75m, and New Road when the level is above 6.18m. Please refer to the latest gauge levels on Check for Flooding and Somerset Council’s website for information on road closures in the area. 
Further rain is expected through Wednesday and Thursday.  
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Pumping will commence at Currymoor when river levels allow.

items.message: High and rising groundwater levels may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible in the West Dorset area. Groundwater levels are rising in response to recent heavy rainfall. Levels may continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Further rainfall is expected over the next few days which may see levels continue to rise. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. Locations most affected will be riverside footpaths and low-lying land and property in Stamford Bridge. Further rainfall is forecast overnight and tomorrow and levels are expected to rise slowly. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Please activate your flood plan. This message will be updated by 07:00am on Thursday 18th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels this afternoon may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible from the afternoon of Wednesday 17th December 2025.  We expect the river to remain high throughout the next few days and flooding to gardens, driveways or external garages is possible close to the river. 
Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties isn't likely and therefore flood warnings are not expected to be issued. We are closely monitoring the situation.  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads, near rivers which may be flooded This message will be updated by 11:00am on Thursday 18th December 2025  or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Cocker, River Marron, River Derwent

items.message:
River and lake levels are currently falling.  However, further rainfall today, Wednesday (17/12/2025), and overnight, on already wet ground conditions, will see levels rise again this afternoon and overnight.

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the lower Derwent from Bassenthwaite Lake to the coast at Workington. The Cocker from Crummock Water to Cockermouth. River Marron from Ullock to its confluence with the Derwent near Bridgefoot. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. T

his message will be updated by 10:00 on 18 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Ehen at Egremont, Bleach Green, Ennerdale Mill, Bridge End, Vale View, Wood Bank, Rugby Club
items.message:
Rising river levels are expected to cause flooding this evening. 
Flooding is expected on 17 December 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be the river Ehen at Egremont, Bleach Green, Ennerdale Mill, Bridge End, Vale View, Wood Bank and the Rugby Club. Heavy rainfall is expected throughout this evening and into the early hours of Thursday morning (18/12/2025). 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 18 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Plym from Shaugh Bridge to Riverside Caravan Park
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Rising river levels are expected to cause flooding overnight. 
Flooding is expected on 17 December 2025 from around 11:00 PM 
Following rain throughout Wednesday, river levels are rising. 

Properties and low lying areas will start to flood from around 11:00PM on Wednesday. The main areas of concern are properties and low lying areas around Riverside Caravan Park at Plympton, Bickleigh Bridge, and Shaugh Bridge . Flood waters may be deep and fast flowing in these areas. 

River levels are forecast to be at their highest between 11:00PM on Wednesday and 1:00AM on Thursday.

Heavy rain is forecast during the day on Thursday which may bring a further risk of flooding. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses .  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 18 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
